item.title: DC Sues Amazon Over Antitrust
item.description: Washington, DC, Attorney General Karl Racine thinks so, which is why he sued Amazon over antitrust allegations yesterday. It's believed to be the first time that Amazon's been sued by the US government over antitrust allegations. ¬†Until 2019, the suit says, Amazon flat-out banned sellers on its marketplace from offering their items for cheaper elsewhere. In a statement, Amazon said Racine "has it exactly backwards‚Äîsellers set their own prices for the products they offer in our store...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: I must say now that, very very very importantly, I love and respect China and Chinese people." Stat: Guy Fieri's new deal with the Food Network will earn him $80 million over three years, according to Forbes, making him the highest-paid chef on cable TV.

item.title: New Home Sales Slump 6% in April
item.description: ¬† ¬†Prices are üìà: The median price of a new home jumped 11.4% in April to $372,400. According to the latest US housing data... Sales are üìâ: New home sales in April fell almost 6%, more than analysts expected. Lenders called employers to confirm buyers have permission to WFH after the pandemic.

item.title: Vimeo Goes Public After Spinning Off From IAC
item.description: Sud told Barron's that Vimeo's growth will slow later this year as face masks come down and in-person happy hours come back, but should pick back up in 2022.

item.title: Airbnb Unveils New Tools, Features for Hosts and Guests
item.description: ¬†Zoom out:¬†Chesky admitted that Airbnb hasn‚Äôt been doing enough to help hosts, many of whom the company angered at the start of the pandemic when it allowed guests to cancel bookings and receive a full refund. ¬† In Q1, Airbnb reported 64+ million booked nights and experiences, up 13% annually.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: New York City Public School System To Be Fully Reopened in the Fall
item.description: After the abysmal April jobs report, President Biden and some economists argued that greater childcare burdens placed on parents prevented them from getting back to work. Mayor Bill de Blasio announced yesterday that the NYC public school system, the nation‚Äôs largest, will fully reopen in September with no remote options.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Corporate America Scrabbles for CDOs Amid Diversity Push
item.description: In the five years leading up to September 2020, the number of people with the title ‚Äúhead of diversity‚Äù rose 107%, ‚Äúdirector of diversity‚Äù 75%, and ‚Äúchief diversity officer‚Äù 68%, according to LinkedIn.Good luck holding onTurnover among top diversity execs is fairly high. CDOs have been busyDiversity and inclusion hiring spiked last June following global Black Lives Matter protests. For many C-suites, George Floyd‚Äôs murder elevated diversity and inclusion to the top of the agenda.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Yuang Longping, Credited With Saving Millions from Hunger Through Rice Innovations, Dies at 90
item.description: Yuan said his experiences of seeing people starving to death led him to research rice, which serves as the main grain for half the world‚Äôs population. Yuan Longping, the Chinese agronomist credited with saving millions of people from dying of hunger, died at 90 on Saturday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Ryainair Plane Forced to Divert to Minsk by Belarusian Leader, Journalist Arrested
item.description: ¬† ¬†European leaders were stunned and outraged by Lukashenko‚Äôs move. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said officials will discuss taking action in response to the ‚Äúoutrageous and illegal behavior‚Äù of the Belarusian regime.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Summer Movie Season Kicks Off
item.description: After a debacle of a year in 2020 due to the pandemic, the lucrative summer movie season unofficially kicks off this year with A Quiet Place Part II and Cruella, which will hit US theaters Memorial Day weekend. ¬† When F9 hits the US box office on June 25 its performance, plus the success of the previously mentioned blockbusters, will help us learn more about the state of the theater industry. At least that‚Äôs what the movie theater industry is hoping. Last summer, theaters grossed $176 million, a 96% decrease from 2019.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: Now, one-fifth of all rice comes from hybrid rice species, according to the World Food Prize website. ¬†Yuan‚Äôs breakthroughs turned him into a national hero in China and within the international agriculture community.

item.title: Tribune‚Äôs Shareholders Approve Sale to Alden
item.description: Despite loads of opposition, shareholders voted yesterday to approve the sale of Tribune Publishing and its legendary newspaper chain‚Äîincluding the Chicago Tribune, Baltimore Sun, and a number of other local dailies‚Äîto Alden Global Capital for $633 million.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Vaccine Tracker: May 22
item.description: Use vaccines as an aphrodisiac: In partnership with the White House, popular dating apps including Hinge, Tinder, OkCupid, and Bumble will soon introduce features that allow users to a) broadcast they‚Äôve been vaccinated and b) find other vaccinated singles who are down to dose-si-do.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Trial Between Epic Games and Apple Is Over
item.description: But even if it ends up defeating Epic, this trial has perma-flipped flashlight mode onto Apple‚Äôs App Store. Cook also argued that Apple does not closely track the App Store‚Äôs profit and loss; in other words, the company‚Äôs bean-counting doesn‚Äôt interfere with the App Store‚Äôs integrity as a marketplace for users to discover apps.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Tulsa Race Massacre: Learn More About What Happened
item.description: ¬†Nia Clark‚Äôs Dreams of Black Wall Street series offers a deep dive into the riots, but also reflects on the massacre‚Äôs legacy, including Greenwood‚Äôs continued economic struggles, racial tensions, and the unsolved mystery of where the bodies are buried. It runs through everything from national and local factors that precipitated the event to the massacre itself to the aftermath. Go deeper on what happened May 31 and June 1Read:¬†In 1921, journalist Walter White, who would later become the NAACP director, was sent to Tulsa to write about what happened for The Nation. ¬†ABC‚Äôs Soul of a Nation shares the stories of survivors and looks at how the city is still working to heal those wounds.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Make It Work: Recruiting Takeover¬†
item.description: When you apply and are asked about your current company/role, my suggestion would be to reference notable companies, brands, or clients you work with along with the less-recognizable name of the smaller company you work for. is a question I get asked in every interview. ¬†You can always check the Glassdoor profile of a company you‚Äôre applying to, but take it with a grain of salt since reviews on there can sometimes be really old. Everyone says working for a small company/startup leads to valuable skills, but many recruiters may not recognize the company's name.
item.author: Neal Freyman
